On 10/28/12 12:37 PM, Elverton wrote:
> Hello everybody.
>
> I'm using Heritrix 3 and in my crawls, I'm getting a specific error.
>
> *SEVERE Fatal exception in ToeThread #78:
> http://www2.inca.gov.br/wps/wcm/connect/2e668f004ccaadbbb8c4bff8e92b01a3/DSC_2621.JPG?MOD=AJPERES&CACHEID=2e668f004ccaadbbb8c4bff8e92b01a3
> (in thread 'ToeThread #78:
> http://www2.inca.gov.br/wps/wcm/connect/2e668f004ccaadbbb8c4bff8e92b01a3/DSC_2621.JPG?MOD=AJPERES&CACHEID=2e668f004ccaadbbb8c4bff8e92b01a3')*
>
> After this error, the crawl stops. Anybody knows how to deal with it?
> I really, don't have a clue about how to fix it.

It would be the lines *after* the SEVERE indicator that tell what 
happened and thus give clues for avoiding the problem. Can you share those?

Generally, the SEVERE reporting level is used for errors that are so 
foundational that even if they don't stop progress, mean a strong 
possibility of corruption or failure if the current crawl launch 
proceeds. After investigation, restarting (the crawl and Java VM), from 
a checkpoint or the initial setup, is wise.

- Gordon
